title: Terry would have brand new knife and fork brought to him | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Chelsea captain John Terry would have a brand new knife and fork brought to him at lunch every day, according to one former Blues youngster. Terry, who has been with the Stamford Bridge club for more than two decades, was the 'king' at Chelsea and would have fresh cutlery handed to him before he ate in the club's canteen. Conor Clifford, now with Dundalk in Ireland after leaving Chelsea in 2013, recalled fond memories of Terry and told RTE: 'John Terry was the main man there, he was the king of the place. Chelsea captain John Terry would have a brand new knife and fork brought to him at lunch, according to one former youngster at the club Conor Clifford, who left Chelsea in 2013, looked up to Terry and Frank Lampard at the club 'Even down to eating his lunch he would have a brand new knife and fork brought over to him every day. The 25-year-old also looked up to Frank Lampard during his time with first-team and would often ask the Chelsea legend for advice. 'Lampard really took me under his wing when I was there. I looked up to him and I used to speak to him and ask him a lot of questions,' he added. RELATED ARTICLES
